H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H753.def: = the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of an object

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H1621.def: = the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7500.def: = state in which a person has been restored to health and well-being after a time of disease or suffering

H8270.def: = a rounded knotty depression in the center of a person’s belly caused by the detachment of the umbilical cord after birth

H8250.def: = a liquid for humans to drink

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H618.def: = construction ► used for storage of harvested crops

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7647.def: = state in which there is an abundance of a certain commodity

H3342.def: = large container; ◄ normally hewn out of stone and part of a winepress; ► where the grape juice is collected

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H8492.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well-being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6973.def: = process by which humans and deities experience an emotion of strong disapproval and rejection of a person or situation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6329.def: = state in which an object stands unsteadily

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H753.def: = the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of an object

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5278.def: = state in which a deity has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H833.def: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H7491.def: literally: to drip; hence: = state in which an area is saturated with water to the extent that it starts overflowing; this can be used for the clouds when they start producing rain, but also for the earth after abundant rain; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an abundance of good things

H2919.def: = condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life-enhancing; associated with fertility

H3868.def: literally: (qualities) turn from (someone's) eyes; hence: = process by which people begin to lose active knowledge of certain qualities

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H1621.def: = the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

glosses: to hurt one's foot (on something) > to hurt oneself
H5062.def: = process by which a human's foot or both feet come in forcible contact with a stone or other object while travelling, ► which may result in stumbling and injury; ≈ usually used in a figurative way to denote sustaining any kind of hardship in life

18.gl: to hurt one's foot (on something) > to hurt oneself

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H6149.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3689.def: = area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3921.def: = process by which part of someone's body is caught in a trap, which means that that entire person is under someone else's control

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4279.def: = a reference to the day after the current day

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3868.def: literally: (qualities) turn from (someone's) eyes; hence: = process by which people begin to lose active knowledge of certain qualities

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H3994.def: = act by which humans consign other humans or objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
